text: McDowell Technical Community College is a community college in Marion, North Carolina. ==History== McDowell Technical Community College was founded in 1964 as a satellite of Asheville-Buncombe Technical Institute. In 1971, McDowell received its own independent charter becoming a separate community college. MTCC has since continued to expand to include new buildings and a walking trail in 2015. In 2018, the college opened a new laboratory to educate and train students for a myriad of careers in the health field https://wlos.com/news/local/mcdowell-technical-community-college-unveils-its- newest-laboratory| title = McDowell Technical Community College unveils its newest laboratory | Publisher = ABC 13 WLOS | Author = WLOS Staff | Date Published = 25 January 2018 | Date Accessed = 03 September 2018. ==Students== 100% of the student body is from North Carolina. Tuition stayed at $1,900 for both the 2016-2017 and 2017-2018 school year https://ncbusinessdaily.com/stories/511443097-cost-of-college-was-unchanged- for-all-students-at-mcdowell-technical-community-college. 77 percent of the student body received financial aid in the 2015-2016 school year. ==Academics== MTCC offers a wide range of degrees and certificates. There is also an adult education program.https://www.mcdowelltech.edu/apps/pages/index.jsp?uREC_ID=1022335&type;=d&pREC;_ID=1328283 ==References== ==External links== * Official website Category:1967 establishments in North Carolina Category:Education in McDowell County, North Carolina Category:North Carolina Community College System colleges Category:Educational institutions established in 1967 Category:Two-year colleges in the United States
title: McDowell Technical Community College
